abstract: Lars Straub study in journal Proceedings of the Royal Society B finds thiamethoxam and clothianidin, two chemicals from neonicotinoid family of insecticides, reduce male honeybee sperm by almost 40 percent and may significantly influence periodic bee population declines.

headline.print_headline: 2 Insecticides Are Found to Reduce Sperm in Bees
headline.main: Insecticide Can Cut Bee Sperm by Nearly 40 Percent, Study Finds

keywords.value: Proceedings of the Royal Society B (Journal)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Much of the global food supply requires pollinators like honeybees, and the bees’ decline has concerned scientists for much of the last decade....
lead_paragraph: Much of the global food supply requires pollinators like honeybees, and the bees’ decline has concerned scientists for much of the last decade.
